**_Expression and purification of hyperactive Tnp and annealing of linkers_**
Transform competent cells BL21 Gold \(DE3) \(Agilent cat# 230132) with pET15b-His6Tnp.
Plate the transformed bacterial cells on agar plates containing Carbenicillin and
Incubate the plates at 37°C for 14 hours.
Inoculate 60ml LB containing Carbenicillin \(100 μg/ml) with one single colony and
Incubate at 37°C with shaking at 200rpm for overnight.
Dilute the above culture to 1.2 liter of the same media and continue to culture until OD600 of 0.8.

Shake the culture at 200rpm at room temperature for 4 hours. 
  5.
Following cooling down in ice water,
Harvest the cells by spinning at 3700rpm at 4°C for 15min.

Suspend the cell pellets in 30 ml lysis buffer \(50mM Tris-HCl pH8.0, 300 mM NaCl, 20mM Imidazole, 0.1% Triton X-100, 10 μg/ml  Pepstatin A \(calbiochem cat# 516481), 10 μg/ml Leupeptin Hemisulfate  \(calbiochem cat# 108975),  10 μg/ml Chymostatin \(calbiochem cat# 230790),  6 μg/ml Antipain  Dihydrochloride \(Sigma cat#A6191), 1mg/ml lysozyme);
Lyse the cells by sonication with a microtip on Misonix4000 \(total
Process time of 105” with 15” on, 30” off, 90% for amplitude).
7. Spin the lysates at 15,000rpm for 10 min at 4°C;
Transfer supernatant to a new tube and
Wash 0.8 ml 50% Ni-NTA agarose bead slurry \(Qiagen cat#1018244) with 30 ml of 50mM Tris-HCl pH8.0,
Add the cleared lysates to the Ni-NTA agarose beads and
Spin the beads at 1320rpm for 5min at 4°C and
Wash buffer \(50mM Tris-HCl pH8.0, 1M NaCl, 20mM Imidazole, 0.1% Triton® X-100).
Transfer the beads to a 1ml syringe with glass wool on the bottom.
Elute the bound Tnp using 3 ml of elution buffer \(50mM Tris-HCl pH8.0, 1M NaCl, 250mM Imidazole, 0.1% Triton® X-100) by loading 0.5ml elution buffer for 6 times and
Collect the eluates into 6 Eppendorf tubes.
Add for final 1 mM dithiothreitol and 50% glycerol.
Check the purified proteins by SDS-PAGE.
Anneal the bivalent linker and half linker.
Mix 250μl 20μM Bio67F, 250 μl 20 μM 67bpR and 55 μl 10x annealing buffer \(0.5 M Tris-acetate pH 7.5, 1.5 M potassium acetate, 40 mM spermidine).
Heat at 98°C for 5min followed by slow cooling to room temperature to form the bivalent linker.
Heat at 98°C for 5min followed by slow cooling to room temperature to form the half linker.
Suspend 50 x106 cells in 50 ml culture media containing 10% FBS.
Add 3.33 ml of 16% formaldehyde to the cell suspension and
Incubate at room temperature for 10 min with occasional rotation.
Quench the reaction by adding 5.3ml 1.25M glycine.
Gently rock at room temperature for 5min.
Wash cells twice with 50 ml of ice-cold RSB buffer \(10mM Tris HCl pH7.4, 10mM NaCl, 3mM MgCl2).
Pellet in 50 ml of ice-cold Tn5 cell lyse buffer.
Add 1.80 ml Tn5 cell lyse buffer to the
Pipette up and down several times to
Dispense the mixture into 100l aliquots in 1.5ml tubes \(~2.5M cells/tube).
4. Prepare the Tn5-bivalent transposome complex in 1 tube before washing the cells.
Add 16 μl 100% glycerol, 4.5 μl 50 μM annealed half linker, 12.5 μl 9 μM bivalent linker and
Add 30 μl 1mg/ml HisTnp enzyme to the above mixture and
Incubate at room temperature for 20min to form a total of 63 μl Tn5-bivalent transposome complex.
Add 1.6 μl Tn5-bivalent transposome complex to 100 μl cells.
Incubate the complex at 37°C for 2 hours.
Add 1.5 μl of the complex to the reaction and continue incubation at 37°C for overnight with gentle vortexing \(shaking at 800rpm for 30 seconds with 5 min intervals).
Pool the reaction mixtures from 2 tubes into one tube \(total 200 μl).
Wash the tube once with 300 μl EB and
Combine with the reaction mixture to have a total volume of 500 μl in each tube with a total of 10 tubes.
Add 25 μl 0.5M EDTA to a final concentration of 25mM to stop reaction.
Add 16 μl 10% SDS+ 30 μl 20mg/ml Protease K. Incubate at 55°C for 2 hours with shaking at 800rpm, followed by incubation at 65°C for 16 hours.
Add 20 μl RNase A \(Invitrogen cat# 12091-039) to each tube and
Transfer supernatant to a new tube.
Add 100 μl EB to the previous Phenol-chloroform tube, vortex,
Combine the supernatants \(a total of 700 μl).
Repeat the extraction with 700 μl Phenol.
Transfer supernatant to a new tube.
Add 100 μl EB to the previous Phenol-chloroform tube, vortex,
Combine the supernatants \(a total of 800 μl).
Split the 800 μl supernatant to 2 tubes \(400 μl) to
Add 1 μl 20mg/ml glycogen +16 μl 5M NaCl + 1 ml ethanol.
Spin at 12000rpm at 4°C for 15 min. Re
Pellet in each tube with 25 μl EB \(a total of 20 tubes, 2.5M cells per tube).
Repair the gaps generated by DNA transposition.
To each tube of 25 μl DNA,
Add 10 μl 10x NEBuffer2.1, 61.5 μl H<sub>2</sub>O, 1 μl 10 mM dNTPs, 2.5 μl 3 units/μl T4 DNA Polymerase and
Add 5 μl 0.5M EDTA to stop the 100ul reaction.
Add 60 μl prewarmed Ampure beads Ampure XP beads \(Agencourt part number: A63881)
\(the volume ratio beads and DNA is 0.6) to
Sit on bench for 30 min with gentle rotation.
\(Note: always notice beads stick to each other.
This is because gDNA is very large and make beads clog.)
Save the supernatant so that it will be bound to the eluted beads later again for a second binding in order to re
Wash the beads with 500 μl 70% ethanol twice.
Elute the bound DNA from beads with 188 μl 1x cutsmart buffer.
Add the saved supernatants from Step 14 to the eluted beads for the second round of binding as done in Step 13 and 14.
Pool the two rounds of eluates to
Obtain 376 μl per 2.5M cells \(a total of 20 tubes at this step).
10 tubes are subject to NlaIII digestion and the other 10 tubes are subject to MluCI digestion by adding 24 μl 10 units/μl enzymes to each tube and
Check size of sample 2 and 4 after MinElute purification.
Prepare 40 μl C1 beads for each tube \(400 μl reaction mixture).
Wash beads with 400 μl 1x B/W buffer twice.
Transfer the 400 μl NlaIII or MluCI reaction to the beads and
Incubate at 25°C for 30min with gentle rotation.
Collect beads on magnet for 5 min. Re
Wash beads with 1ml lx B/W buffer +0.1% TritonX-100 by rotating at 25°C for 5mins.
Transfer the beads in 1ml 1x B/W buffer +0.1% TritonX-100 after the 5th washing rotation to a new Eppendorf to avoid carry-over contamination.
Collect the beads on magnet for 5mins and
Rinse the beads with 1ml 10mM Tris pH8.0 \(rotation is not necessary).

Prepare elution buffer by mixing 870 μl EB+30 μl 10% SDS+100 μl 20mg/ml Proteinase K. 
  21.
Elute DNA from beads by adding 50 μl above elution buffer and
Incubate at 55°C for 4 hours \(or overnight) with shaking at 900rpm.
Pool supernatant from one NlaIII-digested and one MluCI-digested DNA tubes to
Wash the beads from each tube with 50 μl EB+1M NaCl and
Combine the supernatants with the previous eluates to
Obtain a total of 200 μl eluates \(100 μl
Add 200 μl Phenol-Chloroform to the supernatant,
Transfer 200 μl supernatant to a new tube and
Transfer the lower Phenol-Chloroform phase to the beads tube.,
Combine it with the first supernatant to
Spin the pooled ~400 μl supernatant at 12000rpm at 4°C for 15min and
Transfer 400 μl clear supernatant to a new tube containing 1 μl 20mg/ml glycogen.
Suspend DNA in each tube in 200 μl EB \(5M cells per tube).
Pool the DNA from 10 tubes to
Obtain a total of 2 ml in a 50 ml tube,
Add 10 ml 2x T7 DNA ligase buffer, 8 ml H<sub>2</sub>O, and 40 μl 3,000 units/μl T7 DNA ligase.
There are a total of 20 ml reaction mixture at this step.
Add 20 ml Phenol-Chloroform to the 20 ml ligation mixture,
Transfer supernatant to 24 Eppendorf tubes \(0.82 ml each).
Spin at 12000rpm at 4°C for 10 min and
Transfer supernatant to a new Eppendorf tube containing 0.2 μl glycoBlue and 80 μl 3M NaAc pH5.2.
Warm up the tubes to 25°C and
Spin at 12000rpm at 4°C for 30 min. Re
Pellet in 11 μl sampling buffer from the RCA templify100 kit stored at -80°C.
Split into 2 PCR tubes \(5.5 μl each tube).
There are a total of 48 PCR tubes at this step \(about 1 M cells per tube).
Heat at 97°C for 3 min. Chill on ice.
Mix 5.0 μl RCA Reactions buffer +0.2 μl enzyme
Add 5.2 μl to the denatured DNA.
Pool RCA reactions from eight PCR tubes into 1 Eppendorf tube.
Rinse the RCA PCR tube with 10 μl H<sub>2</sub>O for each tube and
Pool \(about 160 μl per Eppendorf tube for 8M cells; a total of 6 Eppendorf tubes at this step).
Use 20 μl pooled and diluted RCA mixture from Eppendorf tube.
Incubate at 25°C for 20 min. Wash with 70% ethanol 3 times.

Elute DNA by adding 40 μl EB for 10 min. 
  30.
Measure the recovered RCA DNA using Nanodrop.
Check the size of RCA products by loading 2 μl +14 μl H</sub>2~O per lane on E-gel.
Use 20 ng RCA DNA for the 50 μl PCR next step.
Mix the following: 0.5 μl \(<sub>20ng) RCA DNA template, 25 μl 2x NEB Phusion HF master mix, 23 μl H</sub>2~O, 1 μl 10 μM PCR primer N501, 1 μl 10 μM  PCR primer N701.
Run the following PCR program: 98°C 30”; 98°C 10”, 65°C 30”; 72°C 8”; repeat 11x; 72°C 5’; 4°C hold.
Load 20 μl PCR products onto E-gel and
Run the gel for 26 min. Isolate the gel slice containing DNA fragments between 220 and 700bp \(gel slice weight ~200 mg, no more than 230 mg).
Add 900 μl QG buffer ,300 μl isopropanol.
Analyze the eluted DNA by Hi-seq PE sequencing.
Include i5 and i7 \(RC) sequences for indexes.
**_Data analysis: Identification of significant and differential interactions_**
The paired-end tags \(PETs) from Trac-looping libraries were mapped to the human reference genome \(hg19) using an iterative mapping approach with bowtie2.

Significant interactions and differential interactions are identified using custom codes that are available from "https://github.com/binbinlai2012/Trac-looping-methods.":https://github.com/binbinlai2012/Trac-looping-methods
